verbose_text: Strategies for enhancing chondrogenesis in an articular cartilage defect aim at improving the differentiation of mesenchymal cells into chondrocytes for cartilage repair and osteoblasts for the repair of the subchondral bone, the production and maintenance of a new cartilaginous matrix rich in type II collagen and proteoglycans, at increasing the cellularity of the repair tissue to prevent the hypertrophic differentiation of chondrocytes, and at inhibiting articular cartilage degeneration.
evidence: collagen and proteoglycans, at increasing the cellularity of the repair tissue to prevent the hypertrophic differentiation
